keyword: how many calories in a slice of bacon
title: How Many Calories in a Slice of Bacon?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a slice of bacon, including full nutrition breakdown, protein, fat details, and easy tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories in a Slice of Bacon?
assumptions: Standard pork bacon, pan-fried until crisp, one thin slice ≈8 g, excess fat drained; no added seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, cut thickness, cooking method, and fat content. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One slice of cooked bacon provides about 43 kcal and 3 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Baked instead of fried (less oil absorbed)

faqs.q: How many calories in a slice of cooked bacon?
faqs.a: Approximately 43 kcal per thin slice of pan-fried pork bacon.

faqs.q: Is bacon high in fat or protein?
faqs.a: One slice has 3.3 g fat (mostly saturated) and 3 g protein.

faqs.q: How much sodium is in a slice of bacon?
faqs.a: About 192 mg per slice, which can add up quickly.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in bacon?
faqs.a: Yes—frying adds more fat than baking or microwaving; drain well to reduce.

faqs.q: What about calories in turkey bacon vs. pork?
faqs.a: Turkey bacon is lower, around 28 kcal per slice, with less fat.
